text: قالوا۟ لا توجل انا نبشرك بغلم عليم

translations.translation: They said, 'Do not be afraid. We bring you the good news of a boy of great knowledge.'
Have no fear," they said. "We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."
They said: "Do not feel afraid, for we give you the good news of a wise boy."
They replied, "Do not be afraid. We have brought you the glad news of (the birth) of a learned son".
They said, “Do not fear – we convey to you the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.”
They said: "Do not be afraid! We bring you the good news of a boy possessing much knowledge and wisdom."
They said: Be not afraid, surely we give you the good news of a boy, possessing knowledge.
They said, 'Be not afraid; behold, we give thee good tidings of a cunning boy.'
They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom.
They said, "Do not be afraid. We come to you with good news. You shall have a son who shall be endowed with great knowledge."
They said: be not afraid; verily we bear thou the glad tidings of a boy knowing.
They said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed we give you the good news of a wise son.’
They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
They (the angels) said: "Do not be afraid! We give you glad tidings of a boy (son) possessing much knowledge and wisdom."
Do not be afraid' they answered. 'We come to give you glad tidings of a knowledgeable child'
They said, “Do not fear; we bring you good news of a boy endowed with knowledge.”
[The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

[15:53] They said, ‘Do not be afraid; lo!, we, are the messengers of your Lord [sent to], give you good tidings of a knowledgeable boy’, one very knowledgeable [boy], namely, Isaac — as we mentioned in sūrat Hūd [Q. 11:69].
(They said: Be not afraid!) do not be scared of us, Abraham! (Lo! we bring you good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom) in his tender years, clement in his old age.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ قَالُواْ } آمناً له، وتسكيناً لخوفه واضطرابه: { لاَ تَوْجَلْ } منَّا { إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ } من عند ربك { بِغُلامٍ عَلِيمٍ } [الحجر: 53] قابل للنبوة والرسالة، والحكمة الكاملة




{ قَالَ } إبراهيم عليه السلام متأوهاً آيساً، مستفهماً على سبيل الاستبعاد: { أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي } أيها المبشرون في زمانٍ قد انقطع الرجاء فيه عادةً { عَلَىٰ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ ٱلْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ } [الحجر: 54] المانع من الاستيلاء والاستنماء العادي؛ إذ هو في سنٍ قد انقطعت الشهوة عنه، وعن زوجته أيضاً؛ إذ هما في سن الهرم والكهولة

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ قالوا لا تَوْجَلْ }: لا تخف، ثم عللوا نهيه عن الخوف فقالوا: { إنا نبشِّرك بغلام } وهو إسحاق، لقوله

[هود: 71]، { عليمٍ } إذا بلغ أوان العلم
